definitions.definition: To subject to the process of acclimation.
definitions.example: I became conditioned to the absence of seasons in San Diego.

definitions.definition: To subject to different conditions, especially as an exercise.
definitions.example: They were conditioning their shins in their karate class.

definitions.definition: To place conditions or limitations upon.
To shape the behaviour of someone to do something.
To treat (the hair) with hair conditioner.
To contract; to stipulate; to agree.
To test or assay, as silk (to ascertain the proportion of moisture it contains).
(colleges) To put under conditions; to require to pass a new examination or to make up a specified study, as a condition of remaining in one's class or in college.
definitions.example: to condition a student who has failed in some branch of study

definitions.definition: To impose upon an object those relations or conditions without which knowledge and thought are alleged to be impossible.
Determined or dependent on some condition
Physically fit, especially as the result of exercise
